com.scene7.qa.benchmark
Class ChartHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.scene7.qa.benchmark.ChartHandler

public class ChartHandler
extends java.lang.Object

A class that handles chart rendering.
Currently handles line chart for time series data, and bar chart for comparing two data sets

Version:
Jul 25, 2012
Author:
hewong

Field Detail

reportTypes

protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reportTypes
Data structure to store chart type (line / bar) by their report names.
Example: 
 {
         "Today_Yesterday_Builds" : "bar",
         "Has_Alpha" : "line",
 }

barChartNames

protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> barChartNames
A set to store all available bar chart report names.

A set to store all available line chart report name.

renderChart

public java.lang.Boolean renderChart(java.lang.String title,
                                     java.lang.String xAxis,
                                     java.lang.String yAxis,
                                     java.lang.String type,
                                     java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                     DatabaseHandler db,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet serv,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     javax.servlet.ServletException,
                                     java.io.IOException
Handles data structure conversion and detect if given data set can be rendered as chart, then call Google Visualization API to render chart in either barChart.jsp or lineChart.jsp.

Parameters:
title - chart title
xAxis - x axis name (currently not in use)
yAxis - y axis name
type - chart type
rs - result set that will be rendered
serv - caller servlet
req - caller servlet request to include templates
res - caller servlet response to include templates
Returns:
if provided data set can be rendered as chart or not
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if result set cannot be retrieved
javax.servlet.ServletException - if templates cannot be included
java.io.IOException - if templates are not found or cannot be read
